entries.name: Combobox

members.name: element
members.description: A reference to the combobox element.

members.name: filterMode
members.description:
The filter mode for the combobox.
- `manual`: The consumer is responsible for filtering the options.
- `auto-select`: The combobox automatically selects the first matching option.
- `highlight`: The combobox highlights matching text in the options without changing selection.

members.name: firstMatch
members.description: The value of the first matching item in the popup.

members.name: alwaysExpanded
members.description: Whether the combobox popup should always be expanded, regardless of user interaction.

members.name: inputElement
members.description: Input element connected to the combobox, if any.

members.name: open

signatures.name: open
signatures.description: Opens the combobox to the selected item.
signatures.rawComment: /** Opens the combobox to the selected item. */

implementation.name: open
implementation.description: Opens the combobox to the selected item.
implementation.rawComment: /** Opens the combobox to the selected item. */

members.description: Opens the combobox to the selected item.
members.rawComment: /** Opens the combobox to the selected item. */

entries.description:
The container element that wraps a combobox input and popup, and orchestrates its behavior. The `ngCombobox` directive is the main entry point for creating a combobox and customizing its behavior. It coordinates the interactions between the `ngComboboxInput` and the popup, which is defined by a `ng-template` with the `ngComboboxPopupContainer` directive. If using the `CdkOverlay`, the `cdkConnectedOverlay` directive takes the place of `ngComboboxPopupContainer`. ```html
@for (option of filteredOptions(); track option) {
{{option}}
}
```
entries.rawComment:
/** * The container element that wraps a combobox input and popup, and orchestrates its behavior. * * The `ngCombobox` directive is the main entry point for creating a combobox and customizing its * behavior. It coordinates the interactions between the `ngComboboxInput` and the popup, which * is defined by a `ng-template` with the `ngComboboxPopupContainer` directive. If using the * `CdkOverlay`, the `cdkConnectedOverlay` directive takes the place of `ngComboboxPopupContainer`. * * ```html *
* * * *
* @for (option of filteredOptions(); track option) { *
* {{option}} *
* } *
* *
* ``` * * @developerPreview 21.0 */

entries.name: ComboboxInput

members.name: element
members.description: A reference to the input element.

members.name: combobox
members.description: The combobox that the input belongs to.

entries.description:
An input that is part of a combobox. It is responsible for displaying the
current value and handling user input for filtering and selection.

This directive should be applied to an `<input>` element within an `ngCombobox`
container. It automatically handles keyboard interactions, such as opening the
popup and navigating through the options.

```html
<input
  ngComboboxInput
  placeholder="Search..."
  [(value)]="searchString"
/>
```
entries.rawComment:
/**
 * An input that is part of a combobox. It is responsible for displaying the
 * current value and handling user input for filtering and selection.
 *
 * This directive should be applied to an `<input>` element within an `ngCombobox`
 * container. It automatically handles keyboard interactions, such as opening the
 * popup and navigating through the options.
 *
 * ```html
 * <input
 *   ngComboboxInput
 *   placeholder="Search..."
 *   [(value)]="searchString"
 * />
 * ```
 *
 * @developerPreview 21.0
 */

entries.name: ComboboxPopupContainer
entries.description:
A structural directive that marks the `ng-template` to be used as the popup for a combobox. This content is conditionally rendered. The content of the popup can be a `ngListbox`, `ngTree`, or `role="dialog"`, allowing for flexible and complex combobox implementations. The consumer is responsible for implementing the filtering logic based on the `ngComboboxInput`'s value. ```html
``` When using CdkOverlay, this directive can be replaced by `cdkConnectedOverlay`. ```html
```
entries.rawComment:
/** * A structural directive that marks the `ng-template` to be used as the popup * for a combobox. This content is conditionally rendered. * * The content of the popup can be a `ngListbox`, `ngTree`, or `role="dialog"`, allowing for * flexible and complex combobox implementations. The consumer is responsible for * implementing the filtering logic based on the `ngComboboxInput`'s value. * * ```html * *
* *
* * ``` * * When using CdkOverlay, this directive can be replaced by `cdkConnectedOverlay`. * * ```html * *
* *
* * ``` * * @developerPreview 21.0 */

entries.name: ComboboxPopup

members.name: combobox
members.description: The combobox that the popup belongs to.

entries.description:
Identifies an element as a popup for an `ngCombobox`.

This directive acts as a bridge, allowing the `ngCombobox` to discover and interact
with the underlying control (e.g., `ngListbox`, `ngTree`, or `ngComboboxDialog`) that
manages the options. It's primarily used as a host directive and is responsible for
exposing the popup's control pattern to the parent combobox.
entries.rawComment:
/**
 * Identifies an element as a popup for an `ngCombobox`.
 *
 * This directive acts as a bridge, allowing the `ngCombobox` to discover and interact
 * with the underlying control (e.g., `ngListbox`, `ngTree`, or `ngComboboxDialog`) that
 * manages the options. It's primarily used as a host directive and is responsible for
 * exposing the popup's control pattern to the parent combobox.
 *
 * @developerPreview 21.0
 */

entries.name: ComboboxDialog

members.name: element
members.description: A reference to the dialog element.

members.name: combobox
members.description: The combobox that the dialog belongs to.

entries.description:
Integrates a native `<dialog>` element with the combobox, allowing for
a modal or non-modal popup experience. It handles the opening and closing of the dialog
based on the combobox's expanded state.

```html
<ng-template ngComboboxPopupContainer>
  <dialog ngComboboxDialog class="example-dialog">
    <!-- ... dialog content ... -->
  </dialog>
</ng-template>
```
entries.rawComment:
/**
 * Integrates a native `<dialog>` element with the combobox, allowing for
 * a modal or non-modal popup experience. It handles the opening and closing of the dialog
 * based on the combobox's expanded state.
 *
 * ```html
 * <ng-template ngComboboxPopupContainer>
 *   <dialog ngComboboxDialog class="example-dialog">
 *     <!-- ... dialog content ... -->
 *   </dialog>
 * </ng-template>
 * ```
 *
 * @developerPreview 21.0
 */
